section.heading: Definitions
section.chapeau: In this subchapter, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.chapeau: The term “entangle” or “entanglement” means an event in the wild in which a living or dead marine mammal has gear, rope, line, net, or other material wrapped around or attached to the marine mammal and is—

subparagraph.content: on lands under the jurisdiction of the United States, including beaches and shorelines; or
in waters under the jurisdiction of the United States, including any navigable waters.

paragraph.content: Except as used in section 1421f–1 of this title, the term “Fund” means the Marine Mammal Unusual Mortality Event Fund established by section 1421d(a) of this title.
The term “Health MAP” means the Marine Mammal Health Monitoring and Analysis Platform established under section 1421f–2(a)(1) of this title.
The term “Observation System” means the National Integrated Coastal and Ocean Observation System established under section 3603 of title 33.
The term “Office” means the Office of Protected Resources, in the National Marine Fisheries Service.

paragraph.chapeau: The term “stranding” means an event in the wild in which—

subparagraph.chapeau: a marine mammal is dead and is—

clause.content: on a beach or shore of the United States; or
in waters under the jurisdiction of the United States (including any navigable waters); or

subparagraph.chapeau: a marine mammal is alive and is—

clause.content: on a beach or shore of the United States and unable to return to the water;
on a beach or shore of the United States and, although able to return to the water, is in need of apparent medical attention; or
in the waters under the jurisdiction of the United States (including any navigable waters), but is unable to return to its natural habitat under its own power or without assistance.

paragraph.content: The term “stranding network participant” means a person who is authorized by an agreement under section 1382(c) of this title to take marine mammals as described in section 1379(h)(1) of this title in response to a stranding.
The term “Tissue Bank” means the National Marine Tissue Bank provided for under section 1421f(a) of this title.

paragraph.chapeau: The term “unusual mortality event” means a stranding that—

subparagraph.content: is unexpected;
involves a significant die-off of any marine mammal population; and
demands immediate response.

section.heading: Definitions

content.p: The term “Agreement” means the Agreement Between the Government of the United States of America and the Government of the Russian Federation on the Conservation and Management of the Alaska-Chukotka Polar Bear Population, signed at Washington, D.C., on October 16, 2000.

The term “Alaska Nanuuq Commission” means the Alaska Native entity, in existence on January 12, 2007, that represents all villages in the State of Alaska that engage in the annual subsistence taking of polar bears from the Alaska-Chukotka population and any successor entity.

The term “import” means to land on, bring into, or introduce into, or attempt to land on, bring into, or introduce into, any place subject to the jurisdiction of the United States, without regard to whether the landing, bringing, or introduction constitutes an importation within the meaning of the customs laws of the United States.
The term “part or product of a polar bear” means any polar bear part or product, including the gall bile and gall bladder.
The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Interior.
The term “taking” has the meaning given the term in the Agreement.
The term “Commission” means the commission established under article 8 of the Agreement.

section.heading: Prohibitions

subsection.heading: In general
subsection.chapeau: It is unlawful for any person who is subject to the jurisdiction of the United States or any person in waters or on lands under the jurisdiction of the United States—

paragraph.content: to take any polar bear in violation of the Agreement;
to take any polar bear in violation of the Agreement or any annual taking limit or other restriction on the taking of polar bears that is adopted by the Commission pursuant to the Agreement;

to import, export, possess, transport, sell, receive, acquire, or purchase, exchange, barter, or offer to sell, purchase, exchange, or barter any polar bear, or any part or product of a polar bear, that is taken in violation of paragraph (2);
to import, export, sell, purchase, exchange, barter, or offer to sell, purchase, exchange, or barter, any polar bear gall bile or polar bear gall bladder;
to attempt to commit, solicit another person to commit, or cause to be committed, any offense under this subsection; or
to violate any regulation promulgated by the Secretary to implement any of the prohibitions established in this subsection.

content.p: For the purpose of forensic testing or any other law enforcement purpose, the Secretary, and Federal law enforcement officials, and any State or local law enforcement official authorized by the Secretary, may import a polar bear or any part or product of a polar bear.

section.heading: Administration

content.p: The Secretary, acting through the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service, shall do all things necessary and appropriate, including the promulgation of regulations, to implement, enforce, and administer the provisions of the Agreement on behalf of the United States. The Secretary shall consult with the Secretary of State and the Alaska Nanuuq Commission on matters involving the implementation of the Agreement.

subsection.heading: Utilization of other government resources and authorities

content.p: The Secretary may utilize by agreement, with or without reimbursement, the personnel, services, and facilities of any other Federal agency, any State agency, or the Alaska Nanuuq Commission for purposes of carrying out this subchapter or the Agreement.
Any person authorized by the Secretary under this subsection to enforce this subchapter or the Agreement shall have the authorities that are enumerated in section 3375(b) of this title.

The Secretary may use authorities granted under subchapter II for enforcement, imposition of penalties, and the seizure of cargo for violations under this subchapter, provided that any polar bear or any part or product of a polar bear taken, imported, exported, possessed, transported, sold, received, acquired, purchased, exchanged, or bartered, or offered for sale, purchase, exchange, or barter in violation of this subchapter, shall be subject to seizure and forfeiture to the United States without any showing that may be required for assessment of a civil penalty or for criminal prosecution under this chapter.

Any gun, trap, net, or other equipment used, and any vessel, aircraft, or other means of transportation used, to aid in the violation or attempted violation of this subchapter shall be subject to seizure and forfeiture under section 1376 of this title.
The Secretary shall promulgate such regulations as are necessary to carry out this subchapter and the Agreement.

If necessary to carry out this subchapter and the Agreement, and to improve compliance with any annual taking limit or other restriction on taking adopted by the Commission and implemented by the Secretary in accordance with this subchapter, the Secretary may promulgate regulations that adopt any ordinance or regulation that restricts the taking of polar bears for subsistence purposes if the ordinance or regulation has been promulgated by the Alaska Nanuuq Commission.

section.heading: Cooperative management agreement; authority to delegate enforcement authority

content.p: The Secretary, acting through the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service, may share authority under this subchapter for the management of the taking of polar bears for subsistence purposes with the Alaska Nanuuq Commission if such commission is eligible under subsection (b).

subsection.heading: Delegation
subsection.chapeau: To be eligible for the management authority described in subsection (a), the Alaska Nanuuq Commission shall—

paragraph.content: enter into a cooperative agreement with the Secretary under section 1388 of this title for the conservation of polar bears;
meaningfully monitor compliance with this subchapter and the Agreement by Alaska Natives; and

paragraph.chapeau: administer its co-management program for polar bears in accordance with—

subparagraph.content: this subchapter; and
the Agreement.

section.heading: Commission appointments; compensation, travel expenses, and claims

paragraph.heading: Appointment
paragraph.chapeau: The United States commissioners on the Commission shall be appointed by the President, in accordance with paragraph 2 of article 8 of the Agreement, after taking into consideration the recommendations of—

subparagraph.content: the Secretary;
the Secretary of State; and
the Alaska Nanuuq Commission.

paragraph.heading: Qualifications
paragraph.chapeau: With respect to the United States commissioners appointed under this subsection, in accordance with paragraph 2 of article 8 of the Agreement—

subparagraph.content: 1 United States commissioner shall be an official of the Federal Government;
1 United States commissioner shall be a representative of the Native people of Alaska, and, in particular, the Native people for whom polar bears are an integral part of their culture; and
both commissioners shall be knowledgeable of, or have expertise in, polar bears.

paragraph.heading: Service and term
paragraph.chapeau: Each United States commissioner shall serve—

subparagraph.content: at the pleasure of the President; and
for an initial 4-year term and such additional terms as the President shall determine.

content.p: Any individual appointed to fill a vacancy occurring before the expiration of any term of office of a United States commissioner shall be appointed for the remainder of that term.
Any vacancy on the Commission shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment.
The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of State and the Alaska Nanuuq Commission, shall designate an alternate commissioner for each member of the United States section.

In the absence of a United States commissioner, an alternate commissioner may exercise all functions of the United States commissioner at any meetings of the Commission or of the United States section.

paragraph.heading: Reappointment
paragraph.chapeau: An alternate commissioner—

subparagraph.content: shall be eligible for reappointment by the President; and
may attend all meetings of the United States section.

content.p: The members of the United States section may carry out the functions and responsibilities described in article 8 of the Agreement in accordance with this subchapter and the Agreement.
A member of the United States section shall serve without compensation.

A member of the United States section shall be allowed travel expenses, including per diem in lieu of subsistence, at rates authorized for an employee of an agency under subchapter I of chapter 57 of title 5 while away from the home or regular place of business of the member in the performance of the duties of the United States-Russia Polar Bear Commission.
The United States section shall, for the purpose of title 28 relating to claims against the United States and tort claims procedure, be considered to be a Federal agency.

section.heading: Votes taken by the United States section on matters before the Commission

content.p: In accordance with paragraph 3 of article 8 of the Agreement, the United States section, made up of commissioners appointed by the President, shall vote on any issue before the United States-Russia Polar Bear Commission only if there is no disagreement between the United States commissioners regarding the vote.

content.p: The Secretary shall take all necessary actions to implement the decisions and determinations of the Commission under paragraph 7 of article 8 of the Agreement.

Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Secretary receives notice of the determination of the Commission of an annual taking limit, or of the adoption by the Commission of other restriction on the taking of polar bears for subsistence purposes, the Secretary shall publish a notice in the Federal Register announcing the determination or restriction.
